holidays.name: New Year's Day
holidays.description: The first day of the year, celebrated on 1 January.

holidays.name: Independence Day
holidays.description: Celebrates Namibia's independence from South Africa in 1990.

holidays.name: Good Friday
holidays.description: Christian holiday commemorating the crucifixion of Jesus Christ.

holidays.name: Easter Sunday
holidays.description: Christian celebration of the resurrection of Jesus Christ.

holidays.name: Workers' Day
holidays.description: International Labour Day celebrating workers' rights.

holidays.name: Cassinga Day
holidays.description: Commemorates the Cassinga massacre during the struggle for independence.

holidays.name: Africa Day
holidays.description: Marks the founding of the Organisation of African Unity (OAU) in 1963.

holidays.name: Ascension Day
holidays.description: Christian observance 39 days after Easter Sunday.

holidays.name: Heroes' Day
holidays.description: Honours the heroes of Namibia's independence struggle.

holidays.name: Day of the Namibian Woman & International Human Rights Day
holidays.description: Celebrates Namibian women and human rights worldwide.

holidays.name: Christmas Day
holidays.description: Christian holiday celebrating the birth of Jesus Christ.

holidays.name: Family Day
holidays.description: A public holiday following Christmas Day focused on family and togetherness.
